name: SINE-O-TRON 3000
description:
I found this thing lying around in my dad's CD-ROM archive, along with the cover of its manual. I couldn't find the rest of it, but it looks like it's some sort of virtual computer software.

I couldn't get it to work, but I thought it looked cool, so I've uploaded it in case anyone else wants to give it a try. Let me know if you have any success! I'd love to know what it does.

WARNING This software displays rapidly flashing changes in brightness and colour. If you are sensitive to such things, you may want to avoid running it.
